name: Tuna Bites
author: Paul Bevins
summary: This is a great bite-sized appetizer to serve at parties, or to give to kids for lunch, or anytime. These can be served hot or cold, and they freeze well. Serve with sweet chile sauce.
ingredients: ¾ cup uncooked long-grain white rice
3 (5 ounce) cans water packed tuna, drained and flaked
directions: Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan, and stir in rice
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small saucepan over low heat
Stir in onion, cover tightly, and cook until tender but not browned, about 5 minutes
In a large bowl, mix tuna, milk, flour, parsley, sugar, and vinegar
Mix in rice, onion, and eggs
Mold the mixture into 12 balls using 2 teaspoons
Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet or deep fryer
Fry the tuna balls in batches until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes
